comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton and Wystan: Thanks for providing Garrison's full name.  We'll add it to the description next time we update.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Another short biography can be found at diglib.princeton.edu/ead/getEad?eadid=MC060

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This looks to be on a ship. NYT of October 21 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A06EEDB113CE633A... indicates that Garrison sailed on Oct 22, 1913 from New York heading to Panama. He was to be accompanied by General E.M. Weaver. However, this is not Weaver. See hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/hec.15865 for a picture of Weaver. A later NYT article, on October 29, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B02E4DA133FE633A... indicates that Garrison's wife was also on the trip to Panama.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I've been trying to figure out who the other people might be. One possibility for the woman at the left is Mrs. Thomas F. Walsh, the former Carrie Reed. See hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/hec.02619 for a 1913 photo of Mrs Garrison and Mrs. Walsh. Mrs Walsh did go on the trip to Panama, as the guest of Mrs. Garrison. See NYT of Nov 11, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9804E3D8113CE633A... [second piece in this clipping] I'm not convinced it's the same woman, but it could be.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: So then another question is: could the younger woman at the right be Evalyn Walsh McLean. See commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Edward_Beale_McLean_and_E... for a 1912 picture of her.
